Antecedent: My friend ignored me at lunch
Behavior: I felt sad and didn’t talk to anyone
Consequence: It’s okay to feel left out. Try checking in with your friend later — they may not have realized.

Antecedent: The teacher raised their voice at me
Behavior: I froze and couldn’t speak
Consequence: It’s normal to feel nervous when someone uses a loud tone. Taking a deep breath can help ground you.

Antecedent: I made a mistake on my homework
Behavior: I felt embarrassed and threw it away
Consequence: Mistakes happen to everyone. You can always fix it or ask for help.

Antecedent: Someone cut me in line
Behavior: I shouted at them
Consequence: Anger can be hard to control. Counting to five or stepping back can help before reacting.

Antecedent: My classmate complimented my artwork
Behavior: I smiled and said thank you
Consequence: That’s a great example of positive reinforcement — acknowledging kindness encourages more of it.

Antecedent: I forgot to bring my lunch
Behavior: I got upset and blamed myself
Consequence: Forgetting happens. Planning ahead next time can reduce stress.

Antecedent: My sibling borrowed my stuff without asking
Behavior: I yelled at them
Consequence: Try calmly telling them how you feel. Setting boundaries can help both of you.

Antecedent: My friend didn’t reply to my message
Behavior: I kept checking my phone anxiously
Consequence: Waiting can be hard. Distract yourself with something relaxing until they respond.

Antecedent: The classroom got very noisy
Behavior: I covered my ears and left the room
Consequence: That’s a good self-regulation strategy. It’s okay to take a break when overwhelmed.

Antecedent: My parent told me to turn off my game
Behavior: I got frustrated and slammed the controller
Consequence: It’s okay to feel annoyed. Taking a pause before reacting helps you calm down faster.

Antecedent: My group didn’t pick my idea for a project
Behavior: I felt disappointed and stopped contributing
Consequence: It’s okay to feel discouraged. Sharing your thoughts later shows teamwork and maturity.

Antecedent: My teacher praised my effort in class
Behavior: I felt proud
Consequence: That’s positive reinforcement in action — feeling proud motivates you to keep improving.

Antecedent: I didn’t get invited to my friend’s party
Behavior: I felt hurt and stayed home sad
Consequence: Feeling left out is painful. Remember
Emotion_Tag: one event doesn’t define your worth or friendships.

Antecedent: My classmate teased me about my clothes
Behavior: I got quiet and avoided eye contact
Consequence: It’s okay to walk away. You can talk to a teacher or friend who supports you.

Antecedent: My parent reminded me of chores
Behavior: I got defensive and said “I was going to!”
Consequence: You’re not wrong to want space
Emotion_Tag: but calmly explaining helps avoid arguments.

Antecedent: I saw someone trip in the hallway
Behavior: I helped them up
Consequence: That’s a kind response! Helping others builds confidence and empathy.

Antecedent: I got a bad grade on a test
Behavior: I cried and didn’t want to study anymore
Consequence: It’s okay to feel disappointed. Focus on what you can improve next time.

Antecedent: My sibling congratulated me on my project
Behavior: I smiled and thanked them
Consequence: Sharing gratitude strengthens relationships — great social awareness!

Antecedent: My friend shared a secret with me
Behavior: I told someone else
Consequence: Everyone makes mistakes

Antecedent: I joined a new club
Behavior: I felt nervous and didn’t talk much
Consequence: Trying new things takes courage. You’ll feel more comfortable as you get familiar.

Antecedent: My parent said they were proud of me
Behavior: I felt happy and motivated
Consequence: That’s positive reinforcement — let yourself enjoy the moment.

Antecedent: My classmate asked me for help
Behavior: I helped them even though I was busy
Consequence: That’s generous! Helping others can strengthen teamwork skills.

Antecedent: My internet stopped working during a game
Behavior: I yelled and hit the table
Consequence: Frustration is natural. Taking a break or stepping away helps release tension safely.

Antecedent: I missed the bus in the morning
Behavior: I panicked and blamed myself
Consequence: Being late happens. Prepare an extra 5 minutes earlier next time.

Antecedent: My teacher gave me extra homework
Behavior: I felt annoyed but did it anyway
Consequence: That’s great self-regulation — finishing tasks even when annoyed builds discipline.
